Subjective: Left ear feels filled with water; little pain; worse after showering; gradually gotten worse over 3 days; affects hearing; scared; wants pain to stop; no fever; no illness; pain manageable (4/10, 6-7/10 after showering); can't exercise/swim due to pain; new to swimming; cleans ear with cotton buds 3 times a week.
Objective: Temperature: 36.2; Right ear: clean, eardrum fine; Left ear: red, inflamed, swollen ear canal, eardrum not visible.
Assessment: Left ear canal inflammation, likely due to frequent wetness and cotton bud use.
Plan: • Paracetamol up to 4000mg/day for pain; • Anti-inflammatory ear drops 3 times a day for 1 week; • Avoid cleaning ear with cotton wool; • Keep ear dry for 1 week; • Follow-up consultation in 1 week.
